documentation_assessment: CRITICAL DOCUMENTATION FAILURES: This change exhibits fundamental deficiencies that disqualify it from CAB consideration. Implementation plan ('Install Update sets') lacks deployment sequence, specific component identification (despite u_update_set field listing 'SR; AllCare offboarding request' and 'SR; AllCare Update User Cat Item'), duration estimates, and pre-deployment validation steps. Backout_plan contains only 'Backout Update sets' without actionable recovery procedures—missing update set sys_ids, revert sequence, validation checkpoints, or rollback duration estimates. NO test plan provided (test_plan field empty), eliminating visibility into validation scope, test scenarios executed, or acceptance criteria. Justification states desired outcome but omits business impact analysis, stakeholder authorization evidence, urgency rationale, or cost of inaction. Most critically: change state shows CLOSED since 2025-04-30 09:32:01 (close_code: successful, state: 3) with work completed 6+ months ago, yet automated validation runs occurred 2025-11-07/08. This indicates either post-implementation audit, data corruption, improper change record reuse, or failed rollback requiring reassessment—context must be established before any CAB evaluation can proceed.
risks: CRITICAL - CHANGE ALREADY CLOSED: Change record shows CLOSED state (state: 3, closed_at: 2025-04-30 09:32:01, close_code: successful) yet being evaluated 2025-11-08—6+ months post-closure. This indicates either: (1) retroactive audit of implemented change, (2) data corruption/integrity issue, (3) improper record reuse for new work, or (4) failed rollback requiring reassessment. If change already deployed to production, this CAB review is meaningless; if record error, state must be corrected; if reusing closed records, this violates change management protocol.

CRITICAL - CLONE DATA UNAVAILABLE: Clone freshness check returns 'not_found' with no clone record for target instance 'mobizuat'—unable to verify environment readiness. Collection_errors indicates 'Clone info unavailable for target instance (no recent clone record)'. Prior validation notes reference 554-day clone age (18.4 months stale) for 'mobizdev' instance. Without clone data, cannot confirm update sets were developed against current production schema, creating unacceptable deployment risk and blind installation scenario.

CRITICAL - NO ACTIONABLE ROLLBACK PLAN: Backout plan limited to generic 'Backout Update sets' statement eliminates recovery path if deployment corrupts HR offboarding workflows, breaks mailbox access revocation triggers in Exchange/O365 integrations, or introduces description field logic errors affecting active offboarding tickets. Without specific update set revert procedures (sys_ids, sequence), validation steps, and rollback duration estimates, production recovery capability is compromised for critical HR deprovisioning automation.

HIGH - ZERO TEST VALIDATION: Empty test plan (test_plan field null) means validation approach completely unknown—no evidence that HR offboarding scenarios, shared mailbox revocation workflows, description field population logic, LDAP deprovisioning triggers, or Exchange mailbox delegation removal automation were tested. Template shows 100% success rate across 505 changes, but this submission falls significantly below that quality standard.

HIGH - CRITICAL HR WORKFLOW IMPACT: Modification to offboarding description field logic affects critical HR deprovisioning workflows—risks breaking LDAP listener triggers that parse description text for workflow routing, Exchange/O365 mailbox delegation removal automation dependent on description field values, downstream HR systems consuming description data for identity management platforms, or audit/compliance reporting extracting description patterns for offboarding validation and SOX compliance.

HIGH - ENVIRONMENT DRIFT RISK: Update set deployment to production without confirmed environment refresh risks installing code developed against outdated schema, missing dependencies introduced in intervening platform updates, conflicting with recent customizations to shared mailbox catalog items, or overwriting production hotfixes applied since development began.

MEDIUM - DEPRECATED TEMPLATE USAGE: Template shows inactive status (active: false) and unpublished state (template_is_published: false) despite 100% success rate across 505 closed changes—suggests template deprecated or under review. Template last updated 2025-11-05 (3 days ago) but remains inactive/unpublished. Questionable whether template shoul
required_actions: Provide complete documentation (implementation, rollback, test plans) before resubmission.
synthesis: ❌ Automated validation failed; documentation and readiness details are incomplete.

documentation_assessment: CATASTROPHIC FAILURE - This change represents fraudulent template misuse constituting governance bypass. Classified under 'ServiceNow Platform Updates' standard template while implementing expense management application logic (routing PAK currency expenses from Accounting to HR + deactivating PDF generation). Update set 'AZ;STRY0011125;Expense Item - sc_task routing + deactivate PDFs generation' and description explicitly confirm application configuration change, not platform maintenance. Implementation plan marked 'N/A' despite requiring business rule modifications, workflow routing changes, configuration updates. Rollback plan completely absent—mandatory for financial workflow changes affecting audit trails and SOX compliance. Test plan marked 'N/A' for changes impacting expense processing and downstream integrations. Justification 'Requested by Igor' provides zero business case, urgency rationale, stakeholder alignment, or compliance consideration. Template producer inactive (active: false) indicates template should not accept new changes. Most concerning: change state '3' (Closed) with 'Successful' close code dated April 24, 2025, yet contains FIVE automated rejection work notes from November 7-8, 2025—clear evidence of governance bypass or unauthorized reactivation attempt without remediation.
risks: CRITICAL: No clone freshness data available for mobizuat target instance—'not_found' status makes environment validation impossible and configuration drift risk unquantifiable

CRITICAL: Template misclassification bypasses appropriate change controls—'Platform Updates' template has fundamentally different risk profile, review requirements, and approval thresholds than financial application logic modifications

CRITICAL: Expense routing change from Accounting to HR for PAK currency creates unvalidated workflow disruption affecting financial processes, approval chains, SLA compliance, organizational accountability, segregation of duties, and financial controls without documented testing or stakeholder approval

CRITICAL: PDF generation deactivation may break downstream systems consuming expense documentation including ERP integrations, audit systems, compliance repositories, reporting tools, reimbursement processing, tax documentation, and regulatory filing systems—no integration endpoint analysis performed

CRITICAL: Zero rollback plan means inability to restore routing logic or PDF functionality when business disruption occurs—unacceptable for financial operations with potential SOX, audit trail, and regulatory compliance implications

CRITICAL: Change already closed with 'Successful' status (April 24, 2025) but contains FIVE automated rejection work notes (Nov 7-8, 2025)—represents governance bypass, unauthorized implementation, or attempted reactivation without addressing identified deficiencies

HIGH: HR team readiness unconfirmed—no evidence of capacity planning, training, process documentation, system access provisioning, workload impact analysis, or approval delegation setup for handling PAK currency expenses

HIGH: Accounting team impact unexplored—workload reduction/reallocation, handoff procedures, system access adjustments, process documentation updates, and financial controls modifications not addressed

HIGH: Compliance and audit implications unassessed—currency-specific routing may violate financial controls, segregation of duties principles, regulatory requirements (SOX 404), or audit trail integrity requirements

HIGH: Integration cascade failures likely—financial reporting systems, expense analytics platforms, compliance systems, data warehouses, and third-party applications consuming PDF outputs not identified, tested, or notified

MEDIUM: No communication plan for affected parties including Finance teams, HR personnel, end users submitting PAK expenses, downstream system owners, auditors, compliance officers, and external partners

MEDIUM: Template producer inactive status combined with 100% success rate across 505 changes suggests established pattern—however current change fundamentally violates template intent, scope boundaries, and risk classification
required_actions: IMMEDIATE: REJECT change and prevent any implementation under current template classification—this is application configuration change fraudulently misclassified as platform update to bypass appropriate change controls

MANDATORY: Escalate to Change Management leadership and audit team for investigation of governance bypass—change shows state '3' (Closed) with 'Successful' close code dated April 24, 2025, yet contains FIVE automated rejection work notes from November 7-8, 2025; determine if unauthorized implementation occurred or if reactivation attempt is underway without remediation
MANDATORY: Reclassify to appropriate standard change template for expense management application modifications OR elevate to normal change requiring full CAB review with Finance, HR
